title: Small but increasingly annoying Lagspikes.

embed.description: Whenever I play League of Legends, my internet will randomly lag and disconnect, and this happens ONLY when I am playing League of legends. When I dc from a game and close it to reconnect, my internet is fine again and then when I enter game It will once again lose connection.

body:
So i've been starting to get strange Lag spikes, which i havne't seen before, at first i really didn't think about it, but its almost constant now, and i can barely play the game with a character which needs to be able to.
Kite - Skillshot - Move - Auto attack.
Since it suddenly ends up in me lagging out, and maybe even getting Dc'ed.

As i've stated, i've never had this issue before, and its really starting to get to me that its lagging like this, its without warning or anything.

I normally have a normal stable connection in everything else, but suddenly started in League of legends where my Ping could go from 32 (my normal Ping) to about 3000+ Ping, and even though the lag spikes are only 2 seconds long, it makes me unable to act at all (and as stated, sometimes i just Dc' from the game)

I've already done what i could from the link i've posted with this post.
Other things i've tried it.

-Pay for AVG and clean my computer.
-Downloaded Malwarebytes and clean up my computer.
-Reinstalling League of Legends
-'' Repair League of Legends ''
-Never had Pandomedia installed.

And i really want to be able to play again.. without these lag issues.

So if anyone have any suggestions that would really help me a lot {{item:3070}}  {{champion:32}}  {{item:3070}}

replies.body:
I created a couple of videos, they are posted on this forum. Hopefully they help you out. Obviously no stupid downloading required.

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/KN22cdfM-how-to-fight-ping-lag-disconnecting

Erratic jumps in latency (ping) are often caused by issues with your route to the server. If your connection encounters an issue on any node (hop) on the way to the server, it can result in packet loss or latency spikes. Local network configuration can also impact your connection, so a good place to start is by going through our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to ensure your settings are compatible with League.

If you still see issues after following the steps outlined in the guide, please let me know.
